section.title: OpenStack command-line clients
section.para: For scripting work, you can use a command-line client like the python-novaclient client. This client enables you to use the Compute API through a command-line interface.
For information about the command-line clients, see OpenStack End User Guide and OpenStack Admin User Guide.

section.title: Install the clients
section.para: Use pip to install the OpenStack clients on a Mac OS X or Linux system. It is easy and ensures that you get the latest version of the client from the Python Package Index. Also, pip lets you update or remove a package. After you install the clients, you must source an openrc file to set required environment variables before you can request OpenStack services through the clients or the APIs. For complete information about the OpenStack clients including how to source the openrc file, see OpenStack End User Guide and OpenStack Admin User Guide.
